TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PipeStream extends System.IO.Stream
Public MustInherit Class PipeStream Inherits Stream
public ref class PipeStream abstract : System::IO::Stream

summary.span: Exposes a object around a pipe, which supports both anonymous and named pipes.

span.span: Exposes a object around a pipe, which supports both anonymous and named pipes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供基本类，用于在.NET Framework 中的匿名和命名管道操作。The class provides the base class for named and anonymous pipes operations in the .NET Framework. 使用和命名的管道操作的类。Use the and classes for named pipe operations. 使用和匿名管道操作的类。Use the and classes for anonymous pipe operations. 有关管道的详细信息，请参阅[管道](~/docs/standard/io/pipe-operations.md)。For more information about pipes, see [Pipes](~/docs/standard/io/pipe-operations.md). 匿名管道的示例，请参阅[如何： 使用匿名管道进行本地进程间通信](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-anonymous-pipes-for-local-interprocess-communication.md)。For an example of anonymous pipes, see [How to: Use Anonymous Pipes for Local Interprocess Communication](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-anonymous-pipes-for-local-interprocess-communication.md). 命名管道的示例，请参阅[如何： 使用命名管道进行网络进程间通信](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-named-pipes-for-network-interprocess-communication.md)。For an example of named pipes, see [How to: Use Named Pipes for Network Interprocess Communication](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-named-pipes-for-network-interprocess-communication.md).

span.span: for full trust for inheritors.

permission.span: 此类不能由部分受信任的代码继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值传递对象传递给方法来确定已读取的字节数和释放用于进行读取的操作系统资源。Pass the returned object to the method to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. 必须为对每个调用一次调用。 must be called once for every call to . 这可以在相同的代码调用或在传递给回调。This can be done either in the same code that called or in a callback that is passed to . 使用属性来确定是否当前对象支持读操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 如果管道已关闭或无效的自变量传递给，会立即引发相应异常。If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to , the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. 正在执行请求的线程池线程上发生异步读取请求过程中发生的错误。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. 当代码调用时，会引发这些异常方法。The exceptions are raised when the code calls the method.

override this.Dispose : bool -> unit

param.name: disposing
param.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

span.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class and optionally releases the managed resources.

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法称为由公共方法和方法。This method is called by the public method and the method. 调用受保护方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。 invokes the protected method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用与`disposing`设置为`false`。 invokes with `disposing` set to `false`. 当处置参数是`true`，此方法释放由任何托管对象持有的全部资源此对象引用。When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this object references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 方法。This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

span.para: 在派生类中，使所有中的清理逻辑方法。 可以由其他对象多次调用。重写 时，请注意不要引用在以前调用 时已释放的对象。有关如何实现详细信息，请参阅 [实现释放 Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。有关详细信息和，请参阅 [清洗向上非托管 Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

In derived classes, put all cleanup logic in the method. can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回的以前调用指定的字节数组中读取的字节数。This method returns the number of bytes read into the byte array specified by the earlier call to . 返回值传递对象传递给方法来确定已读取的字节数和释放用于进行读取的操作系统资源。Pass the returned object to the method to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. 必须为对每个调用一次调用。 must be called once for every call to . 这可以在相同的代码调用或在传递给回调。This can be done either in the same code that called or in a callback that is passed to . 使用属性来确定是否当前对象支持读操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 如果管道已关闭或无效的自变量传递给，会立即引发相应异常。If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to , the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. 正在执行请求的线程池线程上发生异步读取请求过程中发生的错误。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. 当代码调用时，会引发这些异常方法。The exceptions are raised when the code calls the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 访问控制列表 (ACL) 描述个人和/或组，或没有执行权限在指定的文件上执行特定操作。An access control list (ACL) describes individuals and/or groups that have, or do not have, rights to perform specific actions on a specified file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或移除访问控制列表项](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md).

summary.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a object is connected.

span.span: if the object is connected; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性返回`true`才连接对象。The property returns `true` only if the object is connected. 如果此属性返回`false`，管道可能在等待连接，或可能被断开连接、 关闭，或破坏。If this property returns `false`, the pipe may be waiting to connect, or may be disconnected, closed, or broken.

summary.span: Reads a block of bytes from a stream and writes the data to a specified buffer.

span.span: Reads a block of bytes from a stream and writes the data to a specified buffer.

returns.span: The total number of bytes that are read into .

span.span: The total number of bytes that are read into .

returns.span: This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes is not currently available, or 0 if the end of the stream is reached.

span.span: This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes is not currently available, or 0 if the end of the stream is reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性来确定是否当前对象支持读操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 调用方法进行阻止，直至`count`读取的字节数，或已到达流结尾。Calling the method blocks until `count` bytes are read or the end of the stream is reached. 异步读取操作，请参阅和。For asynchronous read operations, see and . ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个匿名管道客户端和管道服务器。The following example creates an anonymous pipe client and pipe server. 管道服务器使用方法来验证代码以对管道客户端从读取的字节序列。The pipe server uses the method to read a series of bytes from the pipe client as a validation code. 管道客户端和的管道服务器属于同一个示例。Both the pipe client and the pipe server are part of the same example. 服务器部分的示例创建一个客户端进程，并将其作为自变量传递匿名管道句柄。The server portion of the example creates a client process and passes it an anonymous pipe handle as an argument.
